unnormalised: RBI recently issued a notification regarding the linking of Aadhaar with bank accounts. Sources say this is primarily aimed at cracking down on benami transactions. Apparently, lots of folks were using multiple accounts opened with fake IDs for nefarious purposes.
normalised: R-B-I recently issued a notification regarding the linking of Aadhaar with bank accounts. Sources say this is primarily aimed at cracking down on benami transactions. Apparently, lots of folks were using multiple accounts opened with fake I-D-s for nefarious purposes.

unnormalised: The notification specifies that all account holders must link their Aadhaar no. to their bank accounts by 31/12/2024. Failure to do so could result in the account being frozen, which would be a proper hassle, no?
normalised: The notification specifies that all account holders must link their Aadhaar number to their bank accounts by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. Failure to do so could result in the account being frozen, which would be a proper hassle, no?

unnormalised: Linking your Aadhaar is fairly straightforward. You can do it online through your bank's netbanking portal – just look for the "Link Aadhaar" option. You'll need your Aadhaar number – something like 1234-5678-9012 – and your PAN card details.
normalised: Linking your Aadhaar is fairly straightforward. You can do it online through your bank's netbanking portal – just look for the "Link Aadhaar" option. You'll need your Aadhaar number – something like one thousand two hundred and thirty four hyphen five thousand six hundred and seventy eight hyphen nine thousand and twelve – and your P-A-N card details.

unnormalised: Alternatively, you can visit your local branch. Carry a copy of your Aadhaar card and your PAN card. They’ll probably ask you to fill out a form, which they'll then process. Takes a bit longer, but works if you aren't tech-savvy.
normalised: Alternatively, you can visit your local branch. Carry a copy of your Aadhaar card and your P-A-N card. They’ll probably ask you to fill out a form, which they'll then process. Takes a bit longer, but works if you aren't tech-savvy.

unnormalised: This move is expected to improve transparency and accountability in the banking sector. It’ll also help the government in tracking down black money and tax evaders. So, while it might seem like a bit of a bother, it's ultimately for the greater good.
normalised: This move is expected to improve transparency and accountability in the banking sector. It’ll also help the government in tracking down black money and tax evaders. So, while it might seem like a bit of a bother, it's ultimately for the greater good.

unnormalised: But what happens if you already linked your Aadhaar ages ago? Apparently, there’s no need to do it again. You can check your Aadhaar linking status on the UIDAI website. You'll just need your Virtual ID or Aadhaar number. The UIDAI site might also want you to enter a Captcha, so be sure to type it right!
normalised: But what happens if you already linked your Aadhaar ages ago? Apparently, there’s no need to do it again. You can check your Aadhaar linking status on the U-I-D-A-I website. You'll just need your Virtual I-D or Aadhaar number. The U-I-D-A-I site might also want you to enter a Captcha, so be sure to type it right!

unnormalised: So, yeah, don't forget to link your Aadhaar by 31st Dec. It’s a small step to avoid bigger headaches down the line. Just do it.
normalised: So, yeah, don't forget to link your Aadhaar by thirty first December. It’s a small step to avoid bigger headaches down the line. Just do it.
